intro: Eremostachys ebracteolata, commonly known as the naked-bract eremostachys, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It is a perennial herb characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Eremostachys ebracteolata is adapted to survive in low-nutrient soils and can withstand extreme temperature fluctuations.
